ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: nor any food except exuding pus
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and has no food except the filth from the washing of wounds,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Nor any food except the pus discharged from the people of hell.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Nor any food except filth from Ghislin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: neither any food saving foul pus,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and the only food he has is filth
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Nor any food save filthy corruption.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nor hath he any food except the corruption from the washing of wounds,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nor any food except filth from the washing of wounds,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: nor any food except foul pus
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [69:36] nor any food except pus, the vile excretions of the inhabitants of the Fire — or it [ghislīn] may denote certain trees therein —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nor any food) in the Fire (save filth) that which spills from the bellies and skins of the people of the Fire of puss, blood and fluids
